text: Bottle. Copper with a cream head. Aroma of dried and some stewed fruit, orange and lemon peel, bread crusts, the meadow. Medium bodied, quite creamy texture. Dominated by herbal and citrus flavours with the malt and dried fruit taking too much of a back seat for me. But it is tasty. Quite bitter with some moderate roasted flavours à la old ales. Must have again - quite like it, may be a grower. Clearly very clever - its Englishness asserts itself to two different audiences at the same time.

Cask Half Pint at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London in Aug 2010 - Reddish Brown in colour. Mega-Hoppy; oily resinous and herbal hops. Fruity; citrus grapefruit, dried fruit, candied peel. Malty; toffee, caramel, slightly roasty malts. Resinous citrus fruity hoppy throughout with a dry bitter finish. Enjoyed this. Lovely Beer! (2010-08)

Bottle. Clear orange colour with little white head. Aroma is light with weet malts and citrusy notes. Tastes follows, with citrus and toffee. Clean finish, low dryness and pretty sweet. I actually like it.

medium aroma - herbal hops, some caramel, green herbs, flowers, raisins, white cherries jam, some biscuits.

medium taste - moderate herbal hops bitterness, some caramel, malt, dried herbs, some honey. bitter, simple and good!

Look: clear copper with strong creamy white head.

Aroma: herbal and woody hops, toffee, caramel, light minty notes.
Taste: almost dry with grassy hoppy bitterness, sligtly astringent.
Flavour: tofee, spicy hops.

Good.

Pint bottle. Clear red-orange body topped with a thin white head. Aroma is light but theres some sweet malty caramel overlaid by flowers and lemon. Taste starts off with fresh pear before an earthy hop note emerges. Some lemon and pepper toward the end. Fairly clean finish leads into a slightly sweet aftertaste.

Nice hazy red orange colour, beige top. Superb pine aroma, orange peel. Sweet start, bitter finish, hoppy and spicy. Moderate to soft carbonation. Excellent beer. Would lile some mora alcohol, but anyway...

Handpump at Craft Beer Co. Clapham, in London. Amber cloudy pour, creamy cappuccino head. Nose: incense a bit, toffee far away. Mouth: sweet (but not too sweet) caramel, roasted malts, silky body and mild bitter finish. Liked it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Color hazy dark orange with small head. Aroma fruity, yeast, malt. Taste sweet, malt, caramel, phenol.
Bottle. Bronze and clear. Small head.Hoppy with citrus and floral flavours. Quite complex and very interesting. Back to form for this brewery.

Bottle from Dronfield Beer Shop. Toffee brown, clear, small off white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, and citrus fruit. Medium/full body with moderate carbonation. Dry malt taste, with mild peppery/fruity notes, slightly underpowered. Dry hop finish with hint of citrus. Pleasant but unremarkable.

Brownish red color, medium head. Smells honey, caramel, dark fruit, intense hops...and metal. Seems that this is a style feature as London Pride also has it (but the latter is more obvious). Palate is surprisingly sweet and malty, but it remains unnoticed as more hops cover into play in the finish. Theres an unpleasant bitter/sour spike in the end.

Holiday, top-50 fun hunt. #-4. From @Bitter Virtue, 500 ml. Pours bright red/amber with a off white head. Aroma of pine, straw, hay, wheat, yeast, malt, medium hoppiness. Taste is very soft, fresh, caramel, hop, hopbitterness modest, typical English hops, the bitterness flattens quite quickly after the sip, underneath easy going and very accessible, some tea, mild and some roasted malts, medium body

Bottle at home picked up from beer gonzo, drunk in the garden on a very warm summers evening. Pours a rich ruby red amber colour with a loose, sticky magnolia head. Aroma is delicate hedgerow berries, tangy red currants, hints of dried orange peel, fruits and nuts. Flavour is composed of semi sweet nutty malts, dried orange rind, red berries, little toasted bread. Palate is semi sweet, rounded, moderate carbonation, and a decent crisp finish. Very well balanced and drinkable.
Bottle - high carbonation, light brown with small tan head. Strong fruity aroma, ting on tongue and in mouth. Better as fizz slows down but not really to my taste.

Bottle. Pours is amber with thick beige head. Aroma of caramel, honey, pine and resin, toffee and herbal notes. Taste is moderate bitter, caramel and toffee mouthfeel. Medium body, slick texture, bitter finish. Very drinkable!

50cl bottle at home from Thornbridge, Buxton. Nose is fruity. Body is deep ruby amber, head is medium, cream white, creamy, fully lasting, good lacing. Aroma is fruity, floral, honey, caramel, chocolate, tea, leaves. Light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy and roasty medium bitter. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Easy dessertish beer, very tasty, great balanced aroma.

Bottle from Cambridge Wine Merchants, consumed at home. Brownish-red, light and translucent. A small film of creamy head sits on top. Delicious scent. Spruce, soft citrus, sweet herbs and turpentine. Exceedingly bitter taste, theres a resiny sweetness which briefly surfaces but its drowned out by the bitter finish. Hop oil dominates the aftertaste. Body in surprisingly weak. Very good but lacking the final punch I was halfway expecting.
Bottle from Chatsworth house, rich Ruby to Amber red colour with a thin foamy and quickly disappearing head. Aroma is fruity pine hops black tea. Taste mid bitter

Bottle 50cl / Botella 50cl.
@ The Beer Garden Store, Madrid, España.
A: Amber / Ambar.
T/S: Malt, citrusy, fruity / Malta, citrico, afrutado.

0,5l from bottle at Hawidere Vienna. bb 04.01.2017. copper reddish clear.small off white head. Smells citric, lychee, lemon grass, light grapefruit, but leathery. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Tastes of spices, some citric notes, peppery, lemon grass, bit unclean, currant notes, lightly sweet, berries, parfume. Finishes lightly bitter with notes of citric, leathery and grapefruit notes. okish but not a fan, a bit weird.

Tap at Pudel. Reddish amber with steady off-white head. The aroma is jammy sweet, toffee, resiny, earthy. Hint of värskekapsas : ) Tastes malty sweet with a resiny bitter twist. Soft on the palate, moderately active carbonation. Earthy dry finish. Very nice.

Pours ruby red-copper with whiteish head. The small head stays for some moments. Aroma is caramel, malt, some toffee. Flavor is sweet and bitter, malt, caramel, some fruits. Finish is dry bitter. Overall: ok, but not really memorable.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 kran w Heritage Birreria, NIewysoka ladna piana, fajnie brudzi szklo, faktycznie czerwonawo-bursztynowe, opalizujace mocno piwo. aromaty slodowo-chlebowo-zbozowo-zywiczne, w tle troche jasnych owocow. w ustach dosc lepkie, z wyrazna, sympatyczna goryczka, srednio- wysycone. dobreOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Tap. Deep light copper color. Firm tan-yellow head, stays. Grainy, dirty, yeast, bit of hops in aroma. Moderate hops, grainy, bit of tobacco and malty in taste. Slightly buttery malts in aftertaste. Soft hoppy bitterness. Medium carbonation. Nice and fresh. Quite drinkable brew.

Bottle at home. Pours the promised red colour with a slightly off-white head. Great aroma: floral and dried herbs, like being in an evening herb garden. Taste is slightly sweet to start, then a massive bitterness follows. Rich malt, flavours of red fruit and more floral, sappy herb. Nicely carbonated and despite a wealth of flavours, quite refreshing. Long, dry finish. Great.
Nice colour and small head hints of mango lychee in the taste great hops coming through well rounded and excellent example of an esb
Draught. Clear red colour. Malty caramel aroma. Slightly sweet, malty, caramel taste, ok
Bottle at home. Just heard Fargo 3 is coming up. Oooh I cant wait! Ok, beer. I was drinking this on Christmas Eve, I think. It was alright.

Somewhat orange citrussy, fruity, toffee nose. Complex but delightful. Quite an alcohol rich nose. Red amber with an off-white head tinged orange. Flavour is orange peel and toffee with some frequencies removed and a little spice. Pretty bitter with a smooth texture. Its fine, like Thornbridge usually is.

Keg at Heaton Hops, Heaton Chapel. Hazy amber shade. Short off-white cap. Lots going on here. Plenty of tangy, jammy, earthy hedgerow fruit notes. Taste is dry and quite strong bitterness. Well put together and a great showcase for these hops.
Keg at the Magpie, dark mahogany with a fine lacing beige head, herbal and faintly antiseptic nose, odd mix of strong herbal notes and toffee on the palate.

Today is a great day for beer drinking, this is a great example of a red ale, crimson coloured with a berry aroma. There is caramel in the palate but it is restrained and therefore not cloying, the toasted malt taste gives this a very pleasant autumnal feel. There is a dryish hopped finish which rounds this off nicely, typically thoughtful stuff from quality brewers
Mooie caramelkkeur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, hop, orange. Smaakt zoetig, fruitig, honing.
Koper oranje helder bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, tropisch fruit, mout. Smaakt fruitig, zoet fruit, mout, bitter. Beetje als een double ipa.
Lovely looking Amber pour with a frothy cream head and clinging lace. Fruity, caramel aroma. Sweet fruity, caramel malt flavour. Sweet candid finish with a Syrup feel.

Lovely ruby red colour and very cloudy. Fruity and with a bitter taste and smooth. Very drinkable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at The Craft Beer Co. Low white lasting fluffy head. Clear thin looking yellow body. Weak fruity malt grass aroma. Dusty dry malt grass flavor with a nice hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long finish.

Bottle. Amber body with offwhite head. Aroma is malty with caramel and some earthy English hops. Taste is also slightly roasted malts with some caramel and hints of herbs. Aftertaste is nice balanced between hop bitterness and roasty malts. Nice one.

50cl bottle. Pours almost clear orange amber with a beautiful lacy light beige head. Aroma is sweet malts, caramel, some buttery aroma, some sweet fruits. Taste is sweet malts, butterscotch, some fruitiness again, nice balancement from the hops, vegetal notes. Medium body, medium carbonation. Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2016 5.9%ABV. ESB

So Im revisiting this one and here are both my reviews for contrast:

First blush.  Tapped:
"Tapped out a deep red brown coming in at about 16ºSRM. Head of nice tan orange foam.

The nose was languorously malty with nice toasted cereal aroma. 

The palate had a light hop balance, with an even finish. A good beer, but not outstanding."

Second fling.  Poured from bottle:
5.9%ABV.  English hopped ale.

Poured out of a rusty Amber.  16ºSRM.

Nose has some nice citrus character along the lines of a ripe Valencia orange with a lot of sweet-sour aroma laced with some refreshing florals.

Mouthfeel is carbonated.  The palate is dominated by sweet buttery flavors which are almost immediately remiscent for me of a Mars bar, with milk chocolate,  toffee, butterscotch and nougat.  There are a ton of rich roasted barley malt flavors of black bread, Horlicks, Maltesers.

Finish is medium long wth hop bitterness which is pronounced.  Not much in the way of florals in the finish. 

Goes on Favorites List!
KRS 311214. Red amber colour with a beige head. Aroma is citrus, hop, pine. Flavour is berries, alcohol, malt, hop, citrus, pine, caramel, bread. Medium body. OK beer.
Bottle, 500 ml from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Hazy dark orange with off white head. Hoppy aroma. Caramel malts, citrus. Nice hoppy and slightly bitterish flavor. Good one.
Draught at Ölrepubliken, Gothenburg 2014. Clear golden beer with an offwhite head. Hoppy bready grassy and some berries ,caramell aroma. Bitter hoppy grassy floral flavour with metallic notes.

Fra fad på M2 Cardinal mai-15: klar rødlig kobber med fint skum. Fruktig og bæraktig aroma og smak. Tørr, og med deilig bitterhet. Lett krydret. Svisker, furunål, karamell, lær, skosåler og sigarboks nevnes rundt bordet. Jeg synes uansett at den er veldig god, og med en ettersmak som jgør at jeg griper etter glasset.

On tap at Mi2, Cardinal. Pours slightly hazy reddish amber with big off-white head. Aroma of pine needles, resin, caramel, liquorice, dried plums, leather. Taste malty sweet with hoppy bitterness, well balanced. Medium bodied.
Reddish colour with off-white head. Aroma of fruits and sweet spices. Flavour is similar with hoppy and fruity finish. Very drinkable although this is not my favourite style.

Bottle, 500ml. Clear maple/copper with a frothy offwhite head. Intense hoppy caramel aroma with hints of dried fruits and toffee. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Light sweetness and bitterness with a very tasty malt character. Very pleasant, I could drink 10 of these.

50cl bottle. Pours clear dark Amber with small off-white head, average lacing. Aromas of molasses, malt and grass. Taste is malty, bitter and balanced. Aftertaste is hoppy with sweetish finish. Nice and balanced but a bit boring beer.

Bottle, 500ml. A clear reddish beer with a big foamy white head. Aroma is of roasted malt, firewood, spices and maybe a hint of orange. Taste is bitter with a slightly metallic finish. Flat carbonation and almost no astringency. Very drinkable and very British.

10.1.2014. Tumma sakea punaruskea, vaalean ruskea vaahto. Makea tuoksu, jossa hieman humalaa. Tuoksussa myös hotain kypsää/rusinaa, ei niin miellyttävää. Maussa paahtunutta mallasta, hieman makeutta ja humalan katkeroa. Hieman erilainen yhdistelmä.
Leider etwas älter. Hopfen vergangen, Honignoten, Harz, Malz. Am Gaumen recht herb, malzig, leichte Beerenfrüchte.

On tap @ LExpress de Lyon, Paris - FR. Color: clear amber red beer with small carbonation and small white ivory head. Smell: nice roasted malt with grassy notes. Taste: nice malt and caramel on mouth very well balanced. Good hoppy presence. Easy drinkable. Aftertaste: caramel and roasted malt.
bottle from beer hawk. not a beer that i would go for but it was ok. dark red in colour fruity on the aroma quite bitter and sweet on the taste with a slight bitter finish

Bottle. Copper/deep red with ligh brown, quite densed, medium head. Very good lacing. Good head retention. Aroma of malts - caramel, toffee along with resin, red fruits and some citrus. Sweet dusty flavour, earthy, definetely bready and some toffe flavours. Clean citrus hops taste, but not so intense.
Medium bodied, semi-dry, medium carbonation, smooth texture, bitter and malty finish. Good ESB, well balanced, highly drinkable.
500ml bottle. Pours deep red with foamy white head. Sweet fruity aroma, taste is sweet, caramel, fruit with lingering bitterness. Very me

Bottle 0,50L. Hazy red/orange colour with big creamy, light brown head and excellent lacing. Very good aroma of pine and resin, as well as orange and caramel. Taste starts light sweet and fruity, but it turns to a bitter side fast, with nice bitter, hoppy and spicy finish. Full body, creamy mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Excellent!

Bottle from the Thornbridge Christmas case. Reddish-brown pour with an off-white head. Lots of red fruit in the aroma with a splash of apricot and some sweet spice notes. Flavours of caramel, raspberry, strawberry and red apple. Crisp, fruit laden finish. Nice.

Bottle. Pours amber with an off-white head. Aroma of citrus, some peach, malt, and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some floral notes, biscuit and cheesy hops. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. An unclear, copper colored beer topped by a dense, finger-thick light beige head. Lightly meaty aroma with citruspeel hoppyness. Some pine cones and caramel. Some cheesy hop notes in the flavor, a good bitterness, and caramel in the back. Nuts and a bready touch. Medium body, soft carbonation. Semi-dry on the palate. Lasting piney and citruspeel-ish finish with a good bitterness. Quite decent this one, but sort of boring anyway. Drinks easily. 141231

500ml bottle from AleselA, Glasgow - clear amber brown, lot of tiny bubbles, good creamy beige head, pine aroma with a bit of malt, intermittent lacing, citrus and malty, very well balanced, just a little too high carbonation

Belle robe rouge, à peine trouble.Belle mousse fine, collante, blanche.Superbe nez, ample, fruité, houblons amers, pèches, ananas.Bouche assez aqueuse, corps léger à moyen pour une IPA, tout en finesse.Petit biscuité, belle amertume.Fruité délicat.Très bonne IPA rousse, légère, délcate.
on tap bel ambrato buona schiuma piuttosto persistente lieve resina malti tostati quasi torrefatto radice lievi astringenze buona intensa discreta secchezza

Piękna , drobna piana. Kolor beżowy, zostawia piękne ślady na szkle i jest trwała. 
Kolor pięknej miedzi, lekko zamglone. 
Aromat wyraźnie chmielowy, lekko ziołowy. Lekko słodki. Na początku lekko winne nuty, ale się rozwiały, został głownie chmiel. 
Bardzo dobry aromat, niemalże jak APA.
W smaku zdecydowane chmiele, z lekkim karmelem. Goryczka zaznacza się, ale szybko przemija. Wyczuwalny karmel. 
Wysycenie spore, ale nie za wysokie. 
Bardzo pijalne.

Bottle at Bishops Arms, Helsingborg. Bitter damp smell of malts. Pours amber red with a small beige head. Taste is damp malts and is very bitter. Palate is oily and easy. Not a very nice beer, the taste just isnt inviting.
0,5l bottle @ Metro, Lahti. Pours clear amber with a medium head. Aroma is fruity malts. Flavor is fruity malts and hops. Quite ordinary, but good.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 500ml bottle served in a pint glass. Pours a slightly amber color forming medium creamy tan head. 
Good retention and lots of thin lingering lacings left in the glass. Strong caramel and caramel malts in the nose.
Sweet and fruity. Quite hoppy and flowery too. Strong caramel in the mouth too. Good citrus and grassy hops character.
Good bitterness. Medium body and excellent drinkability.
[ BA Review @ 7/16/2014 ]
On tap at Christian Firtal. Slightly hazy red amber with a lasting white head. Strong, bready and caramel malty aroma, with a fruity note. Sweet fruity flavour, with weak but clean citrus hops.

Tap @ C4, Odense. Pours dark ruby amber with a small white head. Nutty and sweet malty. Toffee, dark fruit and an almost sweet dusty oxidized note. Medium bodied. Late whisper of citrus. Decent although not my style of beer!

Bottle from sharrow vale beer shop. Pale red ale with a foamy off white head. Aroma is malts a bit nutty with grassy dry hops with resin. Taste is malty and balanced with lovely hoppy bitterness. Prickly carbonation nice oily mouthfeel.

Biggish beige head. Clear deep dark red body with light carbonation.
Resiny tropical fruit aroma with toffee notes. Dryish earthy orangey
taste with spicy herbal notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, slightly fizzy
mouthfeel. Dry orangey peppery spicy aftertaste with cardamom notes.
A bit odd, but not at all bad. (0.5l bottle, from wine monopoly,
Vika, Oslo.)

Light brown colour with thin, lacy head. Initially a very hoppy aroma. As the beer warms some fruity malts come through too. Flavour features candy and sweet fruits. The finish is quite dry and hoppy.

Barwa: głęboko miedziana (wręcz czerwona), klarowna (nieco zmętniona po dolaniu). Piana ecru, drobno pęcherzykowa, obfita i ładnie oblepiająca szkło. 

Aromat: słodki, karmel z landrynkami oraz wyraźnym akcentem ziołowego chmielu i nutą alkoholową. 

Smak: słodowy, dość wytrawny, jedynie z lekkim akcentem karmelu. Dość szybka chmielowa kontra i goryczka powyżej średniej, trochę zalegająca. 

Tym razem czerwone ale z dodatkiem głównie angielskich chmieli. Barwa i piana są wzorowe, aromat także niezły, jednak smak jak dla mnie zbyt wytrawny. Do tego zalegająca goryczka odbiera nieco przyjemność picia. Tragedii nie ma, ale balans mógłby być lepszy.

Bottle, 0.50l. Cloudy reddish amber color with large creamy tan-like head, nice lacing and sparkling appearance. Aroma of tropical fruits, dried fruits and caramel. Taste starts with moderate sweet toasted malt and toffee with nutty notes, following is a bit acidic, mainly from dried fruits and herbs, while finish is moderate bitter. Medium to full body, oily texture and average carbonation in palate. Very nicely hopped non-offensive English ale...
Smell of hop. Copper colour, white head. Aroma of earth, hop. Bitter. Lively carbon.
Deep red/brown color, off white head. Medium body, soft carbonation. Aroma of pine, tropical fruits, caramel. Medium sweet, light bitter taste. OK, but I would like it to be more bitter.

Copper color, with big, porous head. Deep aroma of hops, fresh fruit, herbs, resin. Ligh body, high carbonation. Bitter, but not overwhelming, taste. Easy to drink but also deep; hints of caramel, toffee and apple. Bitter finish.
2014.09 - fles 50cl - helder, amberkleurig, romig schuim - neus : fruitig, rozijntjes - mond : fruitig, licht bitter, mout

Draught. Clear reddish copper colour, thick creamy head. Very hoppy aroma: orange peel, minty herbal notes, green leaves, some sweet ripes and drier, a lot most woody fruit notes. Soft caramel and slightly toasted malts beneath the hops. Slightly sweet, somewhat caramelly flavor with a hint of sour toastedness and mixed bread. Strong herbal and fruit candy hop flavor towards the finish. Slightly herbal/woody hop bite. Soft, velvety texture, medium body. Nice brew.

0.5l bottle. This is a blurry amber looking one with a foamy light lacing off-white head. Really nice nose. Caramel sweet in a way, not to much with traces of red fruits and some apples. Well balanced strong bitterness. English caramel with a piney hop profile. Raspberries detected as well in his one. It has a nice oily feeling in the mouth and its just about average on the bubbles Some nice hints of alcohol near the finish. Really nice, and definitely mike kind of amber/bitter. 30.05.2014

23/VII/14 - 50cl bottle from Biernavigatie (webshop, NL) @ home - BB: 12/III/15 (2014-836)
Bright red beer, big creamy irregular thick yellow head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of citrus, some lychee, bit of grapefruit, mandarins, sweet ripe fruits, some mango. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bit resinous, lots of grapefruit, bitter, citrus, bit of mango. Aftertaste: fruity, citrus, hoppy bitterness, some sweet caramel malts, grapefruit, bit grassy.

YNWA, Kolding, DK.
Tap, 0614.
Amber with small head. Aroma of malt. Flavor with caramel and some fruit.

Pours redish-brown with a lot of head. Pretty carbonated. Smell is very pleasant, citrusy. Yaste is mild, not aggressive. The hoppy aftertaste evolves slowly and with excellent notes of freshness. A very good beer!

Bottle, hoppy aroma, full of herbs and resin accompanied by dried fruits in the background. Intense and rich, great aroma. Pours clear, red with rich head leaving a very nice lacing. Taste is rather malty, with hints of caramel. good bitterness, light sweetness. medium carbonation. Finish could have been better, its a bit too long and stays on the palate - the only downside. Other than that, its a very good beer.

KEg at Beergeek. Pours clearish Red/Brown with a White head. Big hoppy aroma. Peach and Apricot. Slight chocolatey component to the body with some pine floor cleaner hops. Big bitter finish. Delicious.

Bottle from Chester Beer & Wine. Reddish brown pour with a reserved off white head. Caramel malts, fruits and some hop present in the beak. Sweetish malt led flavour with some rescuing hoppage and a little fruitiness. Dryish bitter finish. Its fine but nothing to get too worked up about.
Toasted almond and caramel aroma and taste. Rich and biscuity with a great bitter hop background.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a finger thick off white head. Aroma is roasted malts with bread and toffee, as well as nice citrusy hops with zesty orange peel. Medium body with average carbonation. Flavour is caramel malts with bread, kandi and toffee, as well as zesty orange peel hops with floral and resinous notes giving a lingering bitter and grainy finish.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Brown, quite clear, big tanned head. Smell of fruity hops, caramel, bread, some spices. Moderate sweet, biscuit malts, some dried fruits and caramel. Moderate to medium bitter, nice citrus hops and also a touch of earthy hops. A very well balanced ESB which also tastes superb
Nice floral aroma. Deep clear orange. Nice bitterness with good malt background. Average carbonation dry. Nice English ipa

Drunk from 50cl bottle bought at Malting Pot, Brussels.

Lovely deep red beer full of flavour and hops.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg at the Vintage. Pours copper red, nose is light fruit, toffee, taste is sweet, malty, burnt toffee.

Very intense and complex aroma of resin, grass, citrus just like an IPA but with a really solid caramel core. It doesnt have floral and fruity hints like the american ales, unlike them its more... peremptory. So beautiful red amber clean color with a big rocky white head. Highly bitter taste, as we expect from this style. Medium bodied, average carbonation, long lasting bitter finish. A very very good one!

Bottle from beer gonzo. Pours clear copper brown with a light frothy head. Slightly floral nose, then a pleasant caramel sweetness balancing the bitter. Subtle hints of fruit including citrus at the end. Very drinkable with plenty going on to make it interesting. Very good bitter.
Pour a amber with a fluffy head. Malt and hops on the nose. Some caramel and toffee. Taste is malty with a well balanced bitterness. Hints of grass and citrus. Body and co2 is medium..

Dark amber/coper in colour. Caramel, berries, brown sugar and dried fruit in the aroma. Fruity, nutty and slightly resinous taste with notes of toffee, brown sugar, blackcurrant, raspberry and grassy hops.

Draught @ The Parcel Yard, Leicester. Red colour. Herbal grassy aroma. Nice hoppy bitterness balance with sweet malt. Nice, actually. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught
Aroma-herbs, grass, 
Appearance-amber, clear, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-light body, slick feel, average carbonation, sour finish
Overall-very good

Bottle at DTE tasting. Clear copper pour with thick white head. Aroma of toasty malt, nice fresh grassy hop, quite nice, mild english toffee and tea notes. Taste is nice and peppery, grassy hop, very light toffee and toast maltiness. Palate is med bodied with light-med carbonation. Another nice beer, Thornbridge rarely fails to impress me.
Clear red beer with a thin head. Light hoppy smell. Flavour is like a red rye beer which makes sense. The hops balance things out nicely and the use of English hops keeps it relatively mild.

Bottle at the DTE tasting, Den Haag, via Cotteridge Wines. Poured a clear medium amber with a thin whispy white head. The aroma is woody resin hop. The flavour is medium bitter with a clean crisp, big hop, light metallic, woody palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

50cl bottle @THT courtesy of JMGreenUK.
Thick creamy off white head. Clear amber pour. Nice subtle bitterness. Another lovely Thornbridge beer
At DTE tasting. Poured clear reddish amber with a small off white head. Aroma of sweet caramel malt and red berries. Medium body, flavour as the aroma, quite bitter and roasted.

Bottle shared at the DTE tasting thanks to Jmgreenuk. Pours clear amber with a tan head. Aroma of sweet malt, fruit and caramel. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with light carbonation.

Draught @ Haand Ølfestival 2014
Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, hint of citrus and orange. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long caramel finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Aroma: some bread malts, caramel, floral hops, tropical fruits. Appearance: clear light, golden amber, big frothy white head. Taste: medium bitter, some sweets. Palate: intense hops, citrus, bitter, flowers, bitters lasting, medium carbonation. Overall: nice red ale / ESB, fantastic hop notes throughout. Bottle at the Botanist, Chelsea.

On tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas, pours a hazy copper / amber with a large beige head. Aroma and flavour of caramel-tinged bready malts, a little alcohol and some pine. Very well-balanced, with a good balance of hops and malt. Decent stuff.

50cl bottle from Appellation Wines Comely Bank. 
Appearance - a stunning copper colour with a nice fluffy head. 
Nose - pine with some toffee lurking in the background. 
Taste - toffee cake with some fine herbaceous notes and some ginger. 
Palate - medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long balanced finish. 
Overall - stunning beer.

Caramel, toffee, pine, grass and strawberry in the aroma. Dark amber with a off white head. Medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body with a average carbonation. Overall this is a proper ESB with some character and personality, I really liked this one.

500ml bottle at home. Pours clear copper, thick off-white head. Aromas of dried orange peel, pot pourri and toffee. Taste is oily and rich, quite sweet and malty. Medium body. Clean finish. Very nice.

Bottle from Glug Newcastle. Pours a beautiful dark red. Flavours of fruit, vegetables. Kind of like a pint of Sunday lunch. Heavy but massively flavoursome. Couldn't drink many of these but a nice treat
Tap. Fruity hoppy aroma. One inch, short head, lace. Red copper, half clear. Smooth, crispy, balanced.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tasted at tap on 04/06/2014. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, moderate hoppy and fruity. Hoppy taste of citrus too with a sweet end, leaving a bit sugary aftertaste. Next one please!

03.06.2014, 0,5l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh grassy, leafs, pine needles, sap, lawn, hops, caramel malts, toffee. Taste is slightly dry grassy, leafs, lawn, caramel malts, hay, hops, citrus peel, minerals, bark, soil, pine needles. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry mouthfeel. Nice.

BOTTLE 50CL.

Look: clear dark copper, off-white frothy head.
Aroma: american hop freshness and fruitiness (sweet citrus mostly) and some resin, lots of toffee and caramel, light oily toast.
Taste: starts caramel sweet, followed by a healthy dose of spicy pepper bitterness.
Nose is red berries, rubber whiff, weak bile, decent red grape, feel is medium, taste is red grape, leaves, bitter red currant, later weak cooked vegetables

Bière ambrée rouge, beau col de mousse beige. Nez de caramel, malts, fruits rouges. En bouche : biscuits et fruits rouges : fraises et groseilles. amertume moyenne. Bonne carbonation. Peu de corps. Pas mal sans plus.

Appearance: Clear nutty color with a off white head.Aroma: Balanced fine hoppy, fruity and nutty aroma.Palate: Medium (+) body. Tad sweet and a fine bitterness. Soft to average carbonation.Taste: Bready, some grapefruit, very fruity and fine malty back.Overall impression: Not any typical premium bitter. And so what. A really nice and tasty ale. Fresh and easy drinkable.Personal stats: On tap @ Haand 14 in Drammen, Norway

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg. Clear golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy bready aroma, berries, caramel, onion notes, biscuits, grassy, herbal notes. Hoppy bitter glavor, grassy, floral, metal notes. Decent but a bit harsh.

Draught at Ölrepubliken, Göteborg, Sweden. CLear mahogny, medium tan head. Nutty and caramelly malt aroma with some burnt sugar, spicy and citric hops. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.

Bottle from the brewery. Lovely toasted almond and caramel aroma and taste. Rich and biscuity with a great bitter hop background, grass and nettles fairly obvious in the nose. Long dry finish, late blackcurrant and grain. Excellent.

På fat. Kopparfärgad vätska med lätt smutstat vitt skum. Oerhört inbjudande dofter av ananas, karamell, citrus och jordgubbsglass. Håller inte alls i smaken, som är tunn. Liten kropp. Smaker av karamell och frukt. Gräddig munkänsla. Viss beska i eftersmaken.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein rötliches leicht braunes Bier mit schöner beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, malzig, fruchtig, nussig. Geschmack nach exotischen Früchten, malziig, reife Früchte.

Tap. 
Clear caramel color. Small White head.
Odd Nose, blue cheese like. Taste is the same, malty at first, but finished with a cheesy note. 
Not a favorite. 
Average carbonation.

Butelka 50cl. 
OCZY : piwo jest przejrzyste i ma barwę o odcieniach czerwieni i brązu. Piana jest średniej wielkości o kolorze kości słoniowej. 

NOS : piwo ma mocne aromaty. Słodowe nuty toffi, chleba tostowego, karmelu. Do tego herbata, jałowiec, kwiaty, skórki cytrusowe. 

USTA : piwo jest średnio gazowane, o średniej konsystencji? Puszyste i kremowe w ustach.
Piwo jest średnio słodkie ale nuty słodowe są mocne w tym piwie. Chmiele dostarczają równie mocną obecność, jak nie większą. Gorzkość piwa jest również średnia i przypomina gorzkość skórki cytrusowej i gorzkiej herbaty. Delikatnie cierpnie w posmaku. 

ODCZUCIA : browar używa bardzo mało inwazyjne smakowo drożdże. Jestem pod wrażeniem jak bardzo klarownie wyeksponowane są słody i chmiele. Smakuje jakby nie przeszło fermentacji. Ciekawe i bogate. 

OCENA :
smak : 7/10
pijalność : 8/10

On bottle from Vinmonopolet VIka, Oslo. Clear copper colored, good foam. Aromas of hops, malt, grapefruit, dried fruit; medium high aroma intensity. Medium bodyb& complexity. Good bitterness and balance. Enjoyable

Bottle at home. Poured a chestnut colour with a decent cream head. Aroma is malts, light hops, quite subtle but whats there is pretty nice. Flavour is kind of typical English caramel flavours with some hop fruitiness, better than most though. For an ESB its pretty damn good. Very drinkable.

Bottle from Thornbridge Online Shop. A reddish to brown colour with a good white head. Aroma is of strawberries and a touch of gooseberry. Taste is of raspberry, caramel and biscuit. Pretty dry finish. Decent beer but it truly belies its strength. Decent.

500ml Bottle - Dark amber/coper in colour. Caramel, berries, brown sugar and dried fruit in the aroma. Fruity, nutty and slightly resinous taste with notes of toffee, brown sugar, blackcurrant, raspberry and grassy hops. A good example of what English hops can do.

Pours deep ruby red. Clear with foam head which stays. Nice lacing. Fruity aroma, Strawberry, raspberry, ripe fruits, some pine. Very sweet aromas. Flavour is sweet bubblegum, caramel biscuit undertones with a mild bitterness on finish which leaves dry peach aftertaste. Light body for abv, but flavour is kept throughout. A little watery but that is okay. A very nice beer especially given style. Best ESB Ive had.

bottle at home from alesela
attractive deep chestnut red with fluffy beige head collapsing to a lacing after a few minutes. rich piney notes on the nose with sweet tangerines and toffee malts in the background . dry digestive biscuity malt with toffee and peppery spicey earthy hops with a herbal astringency and bitterness in the finish. fruity, building toffee malt sweetness, pithy hops. great use of uk hops amped up to show what they can really do. a great esb/ amber

Ruby red body, stable head, great looks. Hoppy aroma. Classic hops, but still very hoppy modern. Delicious so malty sweetness to balance. Very nice and very culinary: bet this would go great with food. Quite bitter (I think red meat or a roasted vegetables) and without a harsh ending. Delicious brew and very high class! (50cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

500 ml bottle. BB 06/02/15. Salhojankadun Pub, Tampere, Finland. 
Clear red amber colour with a mid-sized foamy tan head. 
Quite strong hoppy aroma with pine, mild yeast and moderate bitterness. 
The flavour is piney and resiny hops, moderate bitterness and mild malt. Lacks the malty body. Decent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with sarky northerner. Amber colour halo white head. Aroma is wet blankets pine Hops. Taste is some citrus piney hops some malts good bitter finish. Medium body. Ok Tasting smell put me off a bit. Amber ale for me this.
Bottle thanks to s_hartshorne. Copper beer with small head. Aroma of hops and rich dry malts. Taste is dry malts, hops and some tropical fruit. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Molt bona bitter, molt maltosa i amb un toc amarg molt equilibrat.
Muy buena bitter, muy maltosa y con un toque amargo muy equilibrado.
clear, red, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, average carbonation, light body, quite a nice, easy drinking beer, like most of the thornbridge range.
Very nice red hoppy beer with good head, red body, medium bodied, high on aroma but very drinkable and not watery. Good beer for a late summers day.
Cerveza de color rojo con escasa espuma. Olor a maltas. Sabor malteado, acaramelado. Cuerpo ligero, algo grasa.

500ml bottle. Very nice, clear, reddish amber colour with average to huge, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Fruity aroma delivers berry notes of perplexing red fruit jelly (rote Grütze)-intensity: red currant, strawberry, raspberry, in addition some spruce, caramel malty background. Taste is dry, woody, piney, some spruce, resin, conferes ingerneral, and wood, wood, wood - a nuttily touch as well: hazelnut, peanut. Absolutely unique compostion insofar as my experience can count here; sadly the fruity notes dont make their way into taste. The intensity of flavours is really pushed to the limits and leaves me behind with a literal shaking of my head. Meine Fresse, das haut wirklich rein!

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea via SB. Kopparröd, klar, stor vacker skumkrona som långsamt sjunker. Stor kådig humledoft med röda bär, röd grape, färskt trä. Söt karamellig smak men ändå torr för stil, sav, trä, röda bär, lite väl skarp grapebeska. Känns aningen kantig och överhumlad och mer American red ale än ESB trots UK-humlen.

On tap at Schouskjelleren, march 22nd 2014. Dark amber body, medium sized lasting white head. Earthy and fruity aroma with light malt and grass, hoppy taste of citrus fruits with a sweet end, leaving a bit sticky sugary aftertaste, still an enjot\yable beer.

A bottle. A dark reddish brown beer with a big, dense and blond head. The nose is caramelly malty and quite sweet but not unpleasant, fruits, lots of mandarin and blood oranges. Taste of tangy citrusfruits, some mandarin, milder caramell than in the aroma, also some wood and nuts. "Tangy bitter" hops. Medium bodied, smooth carbonation, quite enjoyable. Interesting beer, lots of citrusfruits but not as US hops.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Red-amber coloured with blackcurrant and raspberry flavours, more red fruit and a creamy zesty orange marmalade bitter finish.
On tap at Pipes of Scotland. Dark amber with off white head. Aroma of malt, toast and floral and spicy hops. Taste is metallic, malty, toasted, roasted with earthy and spicy hops.
500ml bottle. Pours reddy brown with a large head. Aroma isnutty mango jelly. Taste has dried fruits and bread. Resin mango finish. Lingering bitterness. Bit too fizzy, would prefer it on cask.

Keg at BrewDog, Stockholm.  Clear copper colour, small head. Caramel, grspefruit and black currant up front. Mid sweet with clean mouthfeel and medium body. Fudge, citrus and red berries. Long bitter finish with some resin. Very American.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Brum. Nice colour and foam head. Flavour is initially quite subtle, but as you drain the glass, you realise how beautifully balanced it is. Great hop levels. Sublime malt blend. Really good.
Draught. Deep amber with a thin head, good lacing. Aroma is pine and marmalade. Flavor is fruity, a little spruce on a marmalade base. Dry finish.

Appearance: Dark red, small off white head. Aroma: dark fruits, a little hoppy and woody. Flavour: cranberry and hops, woody, some bitterness too, a hint of hops and a woody hoppy finish. Not at l what I expected from a Thornbridge & Odell collab. Nice all the same.

On tap @ Cardinal. Practically clear deep reddish body with a finger thick off-white head. Aroma is not very strong, but has a nice and slightly unusually hop profile. Mostly ripe fruit and marmalade with some caramel malt in the background. The flavor is quite fruity as well in the same style as aroma, caramel malt and relatively bitter. Fine and balanced body with a good and fruity bitter aftertaste that ends up with a bit of tea type bitterness. Nice to see the extended use of British hops, but some freshness is missing here to get a top score.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 Clear reddish amber. Beige head. Aroma of fruit marmelade and rosehips. Same taste, balanced with bitterness. Good drinkability.

.5l on tap @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours nice clear amber with high foamy stiff head. Aroma is some yeast, fruits, hops, malts, caramel. Flavor is caramel, hops, citrus fruits, berries. Nice beer!

Draft @ ML Fontainas.
Cuivrée, col épais blanc cassé.
Arôme est houblonné, léger tropical, malt carapils avec un bouquet grillé voire crystal. Petites effluves résiduelles sucrées. En rétro-nasal je note un bouquet tropical fort appréciable et qi met en avant des notes de papaye et de fruits fermentés.
Palais est malté, cara munich, crystal ponctué par un houblonné fruité.
Petite saturation sucrée qui séloigne dune bitter et pour moi se rapproche plus dune APA surtout au niveau des houblons. Note résineuse, sève, malt grillé cara tirant sur le toffee. Un peu collant sur la fin avec qcq notes agrumes; pamplemousse.
Très peu
@ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Dark amber red colour, a lot of beige foam. Aroma of fresh hops. Fruity with notes of citrus. Bitter and dry finish. Easy drinkable.

On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Brownish red colour, large off-white head. Nice aroma of fruity and mildly spicy English hops, hints of resin, also malts and earthy notes. The medium sweet flavour is also fruity, but more in terms of dried or baked fruits and berries, again some earthy tones, well hopped with a firm malty backbone.

Clear reddish colour with small and delicate head on top. Aroma is quite sweet and malty but it also has grapefruits, some pines and hints of anise. Taste is a bit salty with licorice / anise, some bitter grapes but turns into sweeter syrup and toffee. Crispy carbonation with medium body. Somewhat different ESB from what Ive tasted but I really liked it.

Tap at Kittys, Helsinki. Colour is clear reddish copper with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, hints of nuts, sweetness, caramel, bitterness and malts. Not a typical bitter (which is nice).

25 cl. draft @ Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Bright copper red with a big creamy off-white head. Nose is quite a bit of sweet grapefruit, touch syrupy sweetness, pine, oodles of hops, real USA style. Taste is quite a bit of hops, grapefruit, pine, light strawberry jam, touch syrupy malts, reasonable malt base, touch caramel malt feel, touch grass in the back. Quite clean, fine brew, Thornbridge continues being lovely.

Draught @ Black Door, Helsinki. Pours a ruby amber colour with a creamy, lacy head. Aroma of red berries, chocolate, pine and citrus. Rich flavour of caramel, orange pith, pine, some earthiness and crisp bitterness. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Rich and tasty.
Pours a nice amber colour, taste is well balanced with the hops with a nice malt character
Keg at DAda; clear copper pour with luxurious beige head, big tropical hop aroma, pine hop taste, citrus caramel along with some berries.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2014 Tap @ Naamat
Reddish amber to orange clear beer. Off white frothy head leaving lacing on the glass. Aroma is flowery, caramelly sweet and berryish crisp. Taste is bisquity and caramelly malty, flowery and bitter. Medium full, somewhat rough palate. Medium full and medium strong bitter finish. Kind of like a mix between an ESB and an American Amber Ale. Not bad but nothing special.

Tap at Cross Scythes, Sheffield. Copper colour. Off white, bubbly head. Sweet malt. Thick grain. Red fruit. Taste is sweet, red fruit. Then plenty of hop bitterness. Palate is chewy sweet. Finish is bitter. Not as memorable as I recall.

Draft at Howl at the Moon, Hackney on 11 January 2014. Poured a clear amber colour with a medium, tight white head and some lacing. Mild aroma with some toffee and a slightly salty edge. Initial flavours of grassy hop, butterscotch and some meatiness. Malty finish with some bitter pine and burnt sugar. Somewhat disappointing.
Draught@ Black Door. Deep amber, lacing white head. Slight berry notes, caramel, hops. Flavor similar. Quite sweet. Not for me really.- beerbasher/winphone

Tap (Black Door, Helsinki)
Amazing orange aroma, like a glass of juice for breakfast. Coppery red, small keggy head. Rather crazy perfumey taste. Lots of raw malts. A little bit keggy in the mouth, a little sticky too. Hedonistically, this aint doing it for me. Finish floral and perfumey.
Clear copper body, white head. Aroma has berries, resiny hops and hard fudge. Flavour is quite hoppy with some fruity and caramelly malts. Really nice balance as usual.

(Keg at Black Door, 2013122) The beer poured deep amber and clear. Its head was medium sized, dense and white. Aroma had malts, caramel and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were herbal hops, caramel, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was sweet and bitter. A bit weird but still tasty brew.
Draught at Black Door. Red color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, floral hops, resin and a bit of pine. Bitter finish with grapefruit, resin and caramel. Excellent red ale.

Draught @ Black Door
Aroma has fruity hops, some raspberries and some resiny notes. Also hints of hay. Flavour has lots of raspberries, some resiny hops and hints of fruits. Too much berries here, I expected more. Not the most typical ESB, more like amber ale.

Good citric, limey, green hops on nose, raisin-red caramels. Clean medium bodied, bitter, with a bit of residual sweetness. Autumny grassy citrus hops, warming caramels. Overall once again an excellent brew from these guys. Clean, flavourful, hoppy.

Bitter na amerykańskich chmielach. Posiadał piękną herbacianą barwę, zapach chmielowy z nutami cytrusów, lekko słodowy, bardzo orzeźwiający. Bardzo pijalne, bardzo dobre!

UPDATED: APR 18, 2014 Keg @ The Cottage, Galway [160414]
Caramel brown, clear, thin off white head, good colour
Aroma - Soft caramel malts, soft light sweet red berry malts, dab of orange, slight floral notes, slightly perfumy, nice
Taste - Nice soft sweet red berry malts, some hop resins, slightly orangey, caramel malts, toffee malts, gentle flavour
Palate - Medium carb and body, bit oily, smooth texture. Finish of caramel malts, soft bitter hops
Overall - Reasonable, fairly decent beer overall but not one of Thornbridges best

Cask @ Brew Dock, Dublin [141113] 7/2/6/2/12  2.9
Caramel brown. very hazy, frothy off white head
Aroma of fruity caramel malts, soft citrus hops, hint of orange
Taste of caramel malts, fruity malts, toffee, soft citrus zest
Palate - Medium body. Finish rather dry, powdery, bitter rather rough linger
Overall - This was at the end of the cask...needs a re-rate. This time just wasnt great at all

Keg at Well & Bucket- 9th Nov 2013. Amber colour with an off white head. Nose is malt, biscuits, some fruit and pine. Taste is somewhat sweet finishing with bitterness of medium duration. Nice to see this back again but I do prefer it in casks.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text:
Pours mahogany red. Aroma is caramel, honey, rye bread. Taste is caramel, raisins, honey, malt. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours deep reddish amber with one finger of thick white head. Aroma of pine, light resin, light caramel, citrus, blood grape. Taste is light bitter before a semi long sweet finish. Body is light and smooth, soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
All the character and depth youd expect from a US amber with  a hint of herb mingled in with the usual citrus kick and biscuity base. Top drawer!

20/05/2013 Buskers Pub (handpump). Ambrata carica, molto intensa, con riflessi miele di castagno, schiuma bianca abbondante e discretamente persistente. Al naso sentori di malto, lieve tostato, luppolo, con note erbacee e agrumate. In bocca è equilibrata, malto ben presente, finale amaro discreto, non eccessivo. Corpo leggero, ottima beva, carbonazione soft. Non male!
On keg at Coach and Horse Dronfield - Clear, red amber body with a long-lasting creamy light tan head and some lacing. Bitter grainy citrus peel flavour. Medium body is fairly bitter. Not bad.

Tap @ Cask Pub and Kitchen, London. Clear amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 260413
keg at the bat ... copper red ... big tan head ... soft dry zezty hop nose ... creamy malts ... woddy malts... little bitter .... little cheesy in linger ... not me

Aroma: Caramel, toffee apple and dried apricot.

Appearance: Hazy amber red body with a thin off-white head. Average carbonation. Light lacing. 

Taste: Herbal, earthy and hints of pear. Slightly sour, bitter finish. 

Palate: Thin to medium body with a watery, slightly oily texture. Light carbonation fizz. 

Overall: A really solid, complex Bitter.

Bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours hazy dark amber with a huge creamy tanned head. Aroma of dark fruits and wood. Taste is fruity, dark fruits,with plenty of good bitterness, sharp minty finish, very good beer in my book.

Cask @ Black Door, Helsinki

Pours dark amber orange with a bubbly white head. Aroma of caramel malts, fruity hops and toffee. Taste is hoppy with notes of fruits, grass and caramel malts. Finish is fruity and sweetish with notes of bitter hops and toffee. Nice, tasty and hoppy real ale.

Cask at Blackdoor, Helsinki. Dark amber in color with foamy white head. Fruity, tropical fruits to be more exact in aroma, some malts also in there. Taste is more mild, some grassy bitterness with hints of citrus and mild grapefruit. Mid-bitter in aftertaste as well.

Cask pour at Cask, Pimlico. Hoppy reds arent necessarily a big lure for me, and thats what this beer was, regardless of the (now pretty capacious) "Bitter" category. Light copper pour, fairly clear, only medium carbonation. Bright citrus and hops in the nose, with a goodly amount of candy too. Mouthfeel a bit too slick, which tended to enhance the sweet malts perhaps a bit too much. Okay.

Bottle from Bieresgourmet webshop. Pours a near-murky nut brown body with a big creamy off-white head. Nose is licorice, nougat, dark fruits, raisins, hints of grass and herbs. Taste is deep dark fruits, dark malts, caramel, heather, honey, hints of grass and white pepper. Medium body and carbonation. A well-modulated and integrated taste profile with an original stone-fruity twist. Nice one, and very far from a "bland bitter".

Cask at Cask & Kitchen, Pimlico, Saturday 15th September 2012  Reddy brown appearance with a slight haze. Really hoppy red IPA. Perhaps a flatness on the tongue which lets it down a little, needs just a little more sparkle as it is clearly a decent beer. Mouthfeel also a little thin, but in the mouth this is fruity with a tendency towards citrus. Good but not great.  A7 A3 T7 P4 Ov14  3.4

Cask at the Cask, Pimlico - 07/09/12.
Slightly hazy russet brown with a thin off-white head that soon cleared.
Musty nose, earth, sweet malts and stale fart.
Hop forward in taste, wood, pine, caramelised sugars. 
Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Surprisingly watery for a 5.9% beer.
Didnt do a lot for me!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Half, hand-pump, cask ale at Port Street Beer House in Manchester. Nitro creamy, white head completely blanketing the glassware. Hazy, amber-red body. Aroma of dark fruits and apricot. Taste good with its blend of red oranges, citrus shells and lemon. Satisfying dark bitter aftertaste. Oily palate. (07.07.2012).
UPDATED: AUG 18, 2012 cask. murky red. nice hop aroma, light fruits. sweet caramel, generous yeast, and English hops in the taste.

Cask in The Craft Beer Co. Clour is reddish, clearish with white bubbly foam head. Nose is light toasty notes and citrous. Has a very light toasty malt character and then some citrous hop kick. Body is very light and finish is dry.
Cask. Deep red color. Lovely fruity nose. Big, boisterously hoppy bitter taste with a lovely dry/smooth finish. Body is medium/full, nicely subtly supporting carbonation. Good.

Love this - classic thornbridge low abv but full on hops. Colour is great - excellent beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Off tap at the Sheffield tap. Pours dark red with thick white head. Massive hop flavour for the strength. Very nice indeed.

Bottled, 500ml from Beer & Spirits, Knaresborough, N.Yorks. 5,000th English Beer. Dark amber with red hue. Smooth caramalt, easy on the palate, no aggressive carbonation, fruity with a sweetish pear note, a hint of raspberry perhaps, moving on towards a citrus note. Simple fruity finish. Decent beer.

@ ACBF 2011. The aroma is very fruity, aprikots, flowers, dried fruits. Hazy, orange coloured beer with a thin head. The taste is bitter, has aprikots, caramel malts. Lots there. Nice complexity. Great red.
Had this one at the ACBF 2011. Red colored brew. Fruity, malty aroma. Flavor is malty, fruity, citrus, decent bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2014 Bottle @ DTE tasting shared by jmgreenuk. Clear amber color, full sized off-white to beige colored head that lasts for quite a while. Aroma is malts, a touch of caramel and nicely hoppy. Taste malts, hops, nicely bitter, caramel. Average to medium body and carbonation.

Cask at Cask, Pub, and Kitchen. An amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, and hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, lemons, hops, and caramel, leading to a bitter finish.

Bottle. Amber, cloudy, small and fully diminishing light brown head.  Moderate, malty and caramel sweetish aroma, some fruitiness and toffee, faint hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and sweetish flavor, caramel and fruitiness, faint roasted malt and faint hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, some caramel and fruitiness, faint hoppyness. Caramel sweetish bitter. Too sweet and fruity for me.

(Cask at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London, 21 May 2011) Dark reddish amber colour with foamy, beige head. Fruity, malty nose with citrus, orange peel and caramel. Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, citrus, red fruit and a generous citrussy bitterness in the finish. More than medium body, fairly sweet. Nice, tasty and well made beer.
@ Market Porter, zona London bridge, Londra, una buona strong bitter carica di luppoli inglesi

50cl, as Thornbridge Alchemy Colorado Red, new exclusive English brew Anno 2010, from Den Bierzolder Heule, complex bitter brew, fruity and slightly sweet, balanced, cloudy, good head, good brew, yet expensive

Cask at the Euston Tap. Ruby-brown pour with a clingy, white head. Grapefruit citrus hops,  some earth, bit of resin, honey and caramel. Medium in body with average carbonation. Resinous finish, sweet citrus, mild earth, yeah, really nice and slightly dank citrus and pine. Super solid brew.

Bottle, bought @ Alvinne Beershop.
Deep red brown with a nice, staying, frothy, off-white head. Aroma has nice caramel, lightly toasted, some fine fruity hops with apricot, citrus and pine. Lowish carbonation, fairly creamy and dryish mouthfeel. Flavour has milky chocolate, toasted caramel, mild piney hops. Fairly bitter finish. Some soughy notes and a tad of carboard. Very nice and drinkable, yet not fantastic.

Cask @ The White Horse on Parsons Green, London. 1/2 pint came in nice small tulip glass. Medium brown colour, reasonable head. Mild malty aroma. Sweet malty flavour with hoppy aftertaste. Oily & smooth. A rich strong bitter.
Cask, Sheffield Tap. Ruby amber cilour, cherry and peach aroma. Smooth and creamy, rich fruit flavour that transitions to a deep clove and spice finish.

Bottle @ ACBF. Aroma is malty, fruity, touch of spice.
Flavour is very smooth red fruit, some malt with a fitting bitter touch.
Awesome balance, would loce this as a session ale.
Bottle @ ACBF 2011. A hazy red/brown colored beer, with a foamy head. The aroma of hops, fruits and some spices. The taste is dry bitter, fruity hops. The aftertaste is dry bitter and some sweet.
Bottle at ACBF 2011. Dark reddish pour. Aroma of funky earth and pine. Flavor is slightly bitter, earthy and with quite spicy hops. Ok brew.
Bottle at ACBF 2011. Clear red/amber - yellow head. Amber malts, roasted, sweetness, red berries, caramel, fruity, cookies, toasted. light bitterness. Dry hoppy finish A bit simple.

Bottle at ACBF 2011.
Muddy orange red coloured with a small beige head.
Fruity aroma of caramel, hops, cookies and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of caramel, hops, cookies, liquorice and pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.

Bottled @ ACBF 2011. Dark amber coloured. Murky. Dense light brown head. Aroma of sweetenss, ligth grass, caramel and citrus. Flavour of grass, sweetness, caramel, light cocoa, citrus. Medium to full bodied. Light grassy bitterness in the end.

Ruby-foxy to brownish beer with almost no head. Superb grapey nose, tad vinous, C-hops of the best kind... inclucing Magnum. Glup. The citrussy hosp dominate, but there is a slight, rather pleasing caramel backing, or some baking for a good cake. Going to medium body, better carbonated than the looks suggested, and hopoil slick. Another very nice hoppy ale.
Bottle @ ACBF 2011. Pours caramel coloured, hoparoma I would swear it has Amarillo, but apparantly it has not, I guess the UK twist to it did well then. In short: grapefruit over caramel malts.

Cask @ Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico SW1. Pours a clear amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty grapefruit hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor with hints of caramel. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2011 Cask (handpump) @ CASK Pub & Kitchen, 6 Charlwood Street, London, Greater London England SW1V 2EE.Clear medium red brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, nutty, toffee. Flavor is light heavy sweet sweet and heavy bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100802]  7-3-7-3-16 
Bottle 500ml. @ Th. 4th. Alvinne Craft Beer Festival (ACBF) 2011, De Kasteelhoeve, Doorniksesteenweg 314, Outrijve (Avelgem), Belgium.Clear medium to dark amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, caramel, moderate hoppy, orange - citrus, grapefruit, grape, fruity. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, grass, fruity. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110304]  7-3-7-3-15

[3235-20100802] Cask. Grainy hops aroma. Clear, red amber body with a long-lasting creamy light tan head and some lacing. Bitter grainy citrus peel hops flavour. Medium body is fairly bitter. Quite tasty.
(@ CASK Pub & Kitchen, London, England)

Cask - Cask Pub & Kitchen, London. Poured a bright, clear ruddy amber with a medium, lasting creamy beige head leaving an even lacing. Strawberry & passion fruit aromas with a great, straight up green hoppiness and underlying sweet malt. More straight up hop on the tongue, a bit raw with tangerine & strawberry and a good dryish hop bitterness. Moderately soft palate texture, medium body - a touch empty, praps - with a short-medium length finish that was a tad disappointing.

Cask at the Cask Pub & Kitchen, 2nd August 2010. Clear copper with a magnolia head. Slightly fruity sweetness on nose. Strawberry shortcake taste, especially towards the finish. Has some dryness but not many hop flavours evident.

Cask at Cask Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico. Pours bright red (like kola cubes), thin off-white head. Nose; strawberry, raspberry, cherry, malty. Taste; lots of red fruit, sweet, malty, soft on palate, thin, short hoppy finish, tastes weaker than 5.9%. Drinkable, but a bit too sweet for my taste.

Cask, Peterborough Fest 10.  Copper red in colour with a beige head.  Aromas are Weetabix, chocolate and rye malts with a light roast character. Floral and fruity with melon and strawberry.  Earthy and peppery hops.  Flavours are sweet toffee and biscuit malts with grapefruit and pine bitterness.  Yeasty and dry with a resinous long lasting finish.  Good.

Cask handpull at CP&K, Pimlico.  Strawberry fruity.  Strawberry and a touch of diacetyl.  Bit of biscuit.  Maybe a bit rich on the mouth.  No dryness, no big hop presence on the finish.  Bit of tart strawberry on finish.  Good and interesting and reminded me of the BrewDog Zephyr that tasted to me of strawberry shortcake.  I expected more PNW hops on an American red ale interpretation.

Cask Handpump at the Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico 02/08/2010
Big hop aroma. Amber red coloured a little rich on the palate and strong in alcohol with a hint of dryness and bitterness in a malt finish.

Amber colour, small beige head. Aroma is caramel, fruits, some nectar, wood and some mild notes of spruce. Some mild fudge in it as well. Flavour is caramel malts, fruits, nectar and mild notes of alcohol like sweetness. Quite nicely balanced.

Cask conditioned	handpump	Sheffield Tap	Sheffield.  A reddish brown coloured beer with an off-white head and lacing.  Very much a US amber ale type beer in its nose with good hops and sweet fruity berry notes.  Pretty sweet in the mouth and quite restrained.  Certainly not the hop monster the pump clip promises.  Again I have to wonder whether the tight sparkler has helped diminish some of the flavours?  The hops taste almost safe.

2nd August 2010. Thornbridge event at the Cask & Kitchen.  Hazy deep red beer. Light soft palate. Nice malt - very well integrated with some grassy piney hops that are not over bitter and also impart some orange and grapefruit. Harrisoni finds a little stawberry shortcake in there - and of course now I can taste it on the back of the tongue as well. (Nice one Ian).

2010-08-01. Crisp red amber body with a  modest beige head and light lace. 3+ Smooth lovely fruity character, modest rounded citrus, light biscuity touches, modest bitterness throughout. 7+ Aroma is fruity, mild orange and citrus, muted malt accents. Smooth average palate is lightly carbonated. Less assertive than my preference but very well balanced and very drinkable. Cask at CASK Pub and Kitchen, London

A Mes rate. Cask at the Cask.Very clean amber red coloured with a thin off white head. Far too bready on the malt for me. Well hopped and plenty of good English green stuff is showing but its all just overpowered by the bread. Something slightly phenolic about it too. An interesting enough beer just not quite working for me.

Hand pulled cask at the C&K, Pimlico. Amber red with a beige head. Initially rather malty and sweet but resinous fruity hops cut through almost immediately to tantalise the back of the tongue. One of many amazing beers on a very memorable evening.

Cask at Cask pub and kitchen, Pimlico, London. An amber coloured pour with a reasonable creamy head. Good aroma of hops and malt. Tastes malty, hoppy, fruity, roasty, a hint of caramel. Clearly a US inspired beer but with a UK twist. Very easy to drink, I really liked this one.

Cask (handpull) at Cask and Kitchen, Pimlico. An oddity, this; a good depth to the fruity feel but the spicy-herbal mix reminded me too much of an old cough drop left in a sticky wrapper and gone all warm. Hoppy of sorts, perhaps just a little too much going on. A restless child of a beer, seemingly not too content with its lot.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2011 From cask. Pours clear and golden amber with a small off-white to slight tan head. Aroma is mild fruity and malty.  Fruity, roasted malt and slight caramelish. Bitter and fruity into a dry bitter finish. Nice one.7-4-7-4-14=3.6

50 cL bottle @ ACBF2011. Pours hazy dark orange to brown with a small tan head. Aroma is fruity, slight yeasty and mild phenolic. Dry malty, slight sweet caramelish and mild phenolic. Ends medium bitter and dry roasted malty. Lasting caramelish roasted note.7-3-7-4-15=3.6

Cask; Pub and Kitchen, Pimlico, Jans birthday extravaganza!! Looks like a mild ale; ruby red in appearance, fantastic lacing, creamy white head, low particles, soft carbanation, nice nutty malt texture, blackcurrent fruits, well conditioned and excellent for the Autumn months.

Cask via handpump at CASK Pub & Kitchen on 2nd August 2010. Russet with yellow-tinged thin foam head. Hoppy aroma with a touch of aniseed spice in the nose. Sharply hoppy in main kick with a bitter aftertaste. A few berry fruits in background and a light textured, agreeable mouthfeel making the beer easy to drink despite its strength. A well crafted ale, a privilege to enjoy.
